introduction.p: The graph of f(x)=x^3+x+1 is shown in .

image.description: Graph of a smooth increasing curve y = f(x) with a labeled point at (1, 3). The point is marked on the curve, which rises steeply for x greater than 1 and more gradually for x less than 1.

answer.p: The point (3,1) is the reflection of the point (1,3) across the line y=x.

statement.p: Sketch the graph of f^{-1}(x) on the grid given in .

answer.p: Note that the graph of f^{-1}(x) is a reflection about y=x.

figure.caption: The graph of f(x)=x^3+x+1 in solid blue and the graph of f^{-1}(x) in dashed red.

image.description: Graph of a blue function y = f(x) that passes through the point (1, 3), shown with the dashed line y = x and the red dashed graph of its inverse passing through (3, 1). The two curves reflect across the line y = x.

statement.p: Determine the value of f'(1). Then, sketch the tangent line to y=f(x) through the point (1,3).

solution.p: f'(x)=3x^2+1 gives f'(1)=4. The equation of the tangent line is then y-3 = 4(x-1) which is plotted in .

figure.caption: The graph of f(x)=x^3+x+1 in solid blue and the graph of f^{-1}(x) in dashed red.

image.description: Graph of a blue function y = f(x) passing through (1, 3), shown with the dashed line y = x and the dashed red graph of its inverse passing through (3, 1). A black tangent line at (1, 3) with equation y = 4x − 1 is also drawn.

statement.p: Sketch the tangent line to y=f^{-1}(x) at x=3. What is the equation for this tangent line?

solution.p:
Since the slope is the reciprocal of the slope to the tangent line to f(x) at (1,3), we compute the tangent line at x=3 as
y-1 = \frac{1}{4}(x-3) .

figure.caption: The graph of f(x)=x^3+x+1 in solid blue and the graph of f^{-1}(x) in dashed red. Tangent lines at (1,3) and (3,1) to each are shown.

A black tangent line at (1, 3) with equation y = 4x − 1 and the corresponding reflected line at (3, 1) with equation y = ¼x + ¼ are also drawn.
